New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the fourth team in NBA history to win their first 15 games of the season
Key Match Events: Ty Jerome started the game in place of Donovan Mitchell and scored 24 points and 8 assists on 9-15 shooting.
The pairing of Ty Jerome and Darius Garland continued to be effective, with a 130.6 offensive rating and 21.2 net rating when both are on the court.
Post-Match Reflections: Evan Mobley praised Ty Jerome's performance, noting his ability to make the right decisions and how it simplifies the game for the team.
Kenny Atkinson highlighted the importance of having multiple ball handlers, specifically mentioning Ty Jerome's role in reducing the workload on Darius Garland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have a strong record with both Darius Garland and Ty Jerome on the court, as evidenced by their offensive and defensive contributions.
Isaac Okoro and Dean Wade left the game with ankle injuries, and there were no immediate updates on their return.
